timeline.message: Remove javadoc from impl to reduce drift change.

timeline.bodyText: Since the interface is also annotated @Immutable  and according to the spec any SpanContext must be Immutable, this is maybe not the best name to distinguish it from possible other implementations which would also be Immutable. Maybe DefaultSpanContext?
timeline.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: Yeah I had the same impression - we have Immutable* as a pattern in many AutoValue implementations of interfaces currently. Renaming them all to Default seems fine to me, or even *Impl so the implementation orders next to the interface in the filetree.
replies.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: No strong opinion. I'd keep this name for this PR, and we can always rename later, since this is an internal detail.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Does this still make sense on an interface?
timeline.author: tylerbenson
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -17,23 +15,15 @@
  * traceState} and the {@link boolean remote} flag.
  */
 @Immutable

replies.bodyText: I think it does. It places an requirement on all implementers and offers guarantees to users.
replies.author: Oberon00

replies.bodyText: Obviously, it's a soft requirement, since it can't be enforced, but I still think it's a good thing to document.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Not sure why this class is needed, if you just move the "@autovalue" annotation on the SpanContext you achieve the same thing, and just call directly the ctor of the AutoValue, am I missing something?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: As far as I know, AutoValue doesn't support interfaces still.
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.bodyText: this will become more expensive after this change, we should calculate this only once since it is used couple of times per instance created.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: Also, see above...this is still memoized by the implementation.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: Why removing the ability to memoized this call? It may get expensive. I would suggest to not default this and any method that was memoized before.
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: This is still memoized by the autovalue implementation. See ImmutableSpanContext above.
replies.author: jkwatson
